subject: Leadership
title: Intrinsic vs. Extrinsic Motivation
description: A fast breakdown of Intrinsic vs. Extrinsic Motivation for builders.

hook.text: A company doubles bonuses. Productivity spikes for a month, then drops below the original level. What went wrong?

buildup.text: Extrinsic motivation uses rewards and punishments. Intrinsic motivation comes from within: purpose, mastery, curiosity.

discovery.text: Deci and Ryan's research: external rewards can undermine intrinsic drive. The overjustification effect is real.

twist.text: Money matters, but only up to a point. Once basic needs are met, purpose and autonomy drive performance far more.

climax.text: Leaders fuel intrinsic motivation by connecting work to purpose, giving autonomy, and creating paths for growth.

punchline.text: Pay people enough to take money off the table. Then lead with meaning.

quiz.question: What is the overjustification effect?
options: Working too hard for too long
